io.pravega.common.util

Interface ArrayView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteArraySegment

    public interface ArrayView
    Defines a generic view of an index-based, array-like structure.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte get(int index)
      Gets the value at the specified index.
      int getLength()
      Gets a value representing the length of this ArrayView.
      java.io.InputStream getReader()
      Creates an InputStream that can be used to read the contents of this ArrayView.
      java.io.InputStream getReader(int offset, int length)
      Creates an InputStream that can be used to read the contents of this ArrayView.
      void set(int index, byte value)
      Sets the value at the specified index.
      void setSequence(int index, byte... values)
      Sets the value(s) starting at the specified index.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        byte get(int index)
        Gets the value at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to query.
        Returns:
        Byte indicating the value at the given index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is invalid.

      • set

        void set(int index,
         byte value)
        Sets the value at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to set the value at.
        value - The value to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the ByteArraySegment is readonly.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is invalid.

      • setSequence

        void setSequence(int index,
                 byte... values)
        Sets the value(s) starting at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to start setting the values at.
        values - The values to set. Position n inside this array will correspond to position 'index + n' inside the ArrayView.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the ArrayView is readonly.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is invalid or the items to be added cannot fit.

      • getLength

        int getLength()
        Gets a value representing the length of this ArrayView.
        Returns:
        The length.

      • getReader

        java.io.InputStream getReader()
        Creates an InputStream that can be used to read the contents of this ArrayView. The InputStream returned spans the entire ArrayView.
        Returns:
        The InputStream.

      • getReader

        java.io.InputStream getReader(int offset,
                              int length)
        Creates an InputStream that can be used to read the contents of this ArrayView. The InputStream returned spans the given section of the ArrayView.
        Parameters:
        offset - The starting offset of the section to read.
        length - The length of the section to read.
        Returns:
        The InputStream.
